comments:
If you enter -Xj9 as the Default VM Arguments when setting up the IBM JRE as
your project's JRE, the VE doesn't launch properly when working with SWT (no
visuals or palette).  It looks like the VM's not picking up the java.library
argument specifiying the swt library location.  Verified it's not a problem
passing any Default VM arg - specifying -Dfoo=bar works ok.  Specifying -Xj9 as
a VM argument to a Java Bean launch configuration does not interfere with the
launching of an swt class.

This is the .log:
+++ Warning +++: Mon May 24 15:58:31 EDT 2004    Project (Testing SWT2)-VM for
SWTTest.java:err>java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: swt-win32-3051 (Not found in
java.library.path) 
!ENTRY org.eclipse.jem.proxy 2 0 May 24, 2004 15:58:31.825
!MESSAGE 
+++ Warning +++: Mon May 24 15:58:31 EDT 2004    Project (Testing SWT2)-VM for
SWTTest.java:err>
    	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:59)
    	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java:73)
    	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:907)
    	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibraryWithClassLoader(ClassLoader.java:879)
    	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:387)
The changes have been released to HEAD.
1.0M2 is out, so these are now closed in M2.
